org.aludratest.scheduler
Class HierarchicalSchedulerTest

java.lang.Object
  org.aludratest.testcase.AludraTestCase
      org.aludratest.LocalTestCase
          org.aludratest.scheduler.AbstractSchedulerTest
              org.aludratest.scheduler.HierarchicalSchedulerTest

public class HierarchicalSchedulerTest
extends AbstractSchedulerTest

Tests various constellations of sequential, default and parallel suites and sub suites with different pool sizes.

Author:
Volker Bergmann

Constructor Summary
HierarchicalSchedulerTest()
           
 
Method Summary
 void testDefaultSuite()
          Tests a suite without concurrency configuration which consists of 2 classes without concurrency configuration with a thread pool size of 4, requiring that all tests are executed sequentially.
 void testParallelClassWithPoolSize1()
           
 void testParallelClassWithPoolSize2()
           
 void testParallelClassWithPoolSize4()
           
 void testParallelSuite()
          Tests a parallel suite which consists of 2 parallel classes of which each one has 2 methods with a thread pool size of 4, requiring that all tests are executed concurrently.
 void testParallelSuiteWithSequentialClasses()
           
 void testParallelSuiteWithUnconfiguredClasses()
           
 void testSequentialClassWithPoolSize4()
           
 void testSequentialSuite()
          Tests a sequential suite which consists of 2 sequential classes of which each one has 2 methods with a thread pool size of 4, requiring that all tests are executed sequentially.
 void testSerialSuiteWithParallelClasses()
          Tests a sequential suite which consists of 2 parallel classes of which each one has 2 methods with a thread pool size of 4, requiring that classes are executed sequentially, but the methods of each class concurrently.
 void testUnconfiguredSuiteWithParallelClasses()
          Tests an unconfigured suite which consists of 2 parallel classes of which each one has 2 methods.

testDefaultSuite

public void testDefaultSuite()
Tests a suite without concurrency configuration which consists of 2 classes without concurrency configuration with a thread pool size of 4, requiring that all tests are executed sequentially.

testSequentialSuite

public void testSequentialSuite()
Tests a sequential suite which consists of 2 sequential classes of which each one has 2 methods with a thread pool size of 4, requiring that all tests are executed sequentially.

testParallelSuite

public void testParallelSuite()
Tests a parallel suite which consists of 2 parallel classes of which each one has 2 methods with a thread pool size of 4, requiring that all tests are executed concurrently.

testSerialSuiteWithParallelClasses

public void testSerialSuiteWithParallelClasses()
Tests a sequential suite which consists of 2 parallel classes of which each one has 2 methods with a thread pool size of 4, requiring that classes are executed sequentially, but the methods of each class concurrently.

testUnconfiguredSuiteWithParallelClasses

public void testUnconfiguredSuiteWithParallelClasses()
Tests an unconfigured suite which consists of 2 parallel classes of which each one has 2 methods. The test is performed with a thread pool size of 4, requiring that all methods are executed concurrently.
